text:
May 15, 1957
British Broadcasting Corp. Publications
35 Marylebone High Street
London, V* 1
ENGLAND
Dear Sir or Madam:
I received your note regarding our Fact Sheet Service which you
have been receiving. You ask that we supply you with the full
details and the name of the person and/or department who placed
the original order for our NAEB TV Research Fact Sheet Service.
You have been receiving this seriilc since 1955 with the com¬
pliments of Dr. Harry J. Skornia, Executive Director of NAEB.
This year, for the first time, we are asking all those who
have been receiving our Fact Sheets on a complimentary basis,
to continue their subscription by paying the regular $2.50 fee,
or, if they are not interested, to let us know and we will de¬
lete their name from our subscription list.
I am enclosing a U. S. Posted Card for your convenience in case
you wish your name dropped from our list. We hope this will not
be the case.
May I hear from you?
Sincerely,
(Mrs.) Judith B. Cans
Secretary
Enclosures (Postal card and correspondence received M? ly 15)
